body:
Unfortunately, that's a separate issue. This patch only changes the behavior when a request is in scope, making it so that asset paths 'inherit' the protocol of the incoming request. During mail rendering there isn't a request in scope, so the asset paths will default to protocol-relative.

(That said, I'd also love to see a patch for asset path generation in mail templates. I'm currently tweaking each one to be https)

On 20 Nov 2011, at 22:30, Joe Van Dyk<reply@reply.github.com> wrote:

> Would love to see this merged in.  Outlook and iPhone don't handle relative protocols in images in html emails properly.
